intro: Psychotria biattenuata, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Despite its modest appearance, it plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
